(constant) Router

Contains list of all routes

Source:
  • backend/router.js, line 19
Example
// route example
{
   method: 'GET',
   path: '',
   view: 'pages/dashboard',
 Controller    controller: this.dashboardController,
   action: 'index',
 }

Type Definitions

AdminBroOptions

AdminBro takes list of options of the entire framework. All off them have default values, but you can tailor them to your needs easily

Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
rootPath String <optional>
 '/admin'

under which path AdminBro will be available
logoutPath String <optional>
 '/admin/logout'

url to logout action
loginPath String <optional>
 '/admin/login'

url to login page
databases Array.<BaseDatabase> <optional>
 []

array of all databases
resources Array.<BaseResource> | Array.<Object> <optional>
 []

array of all resources. Resources can be give as in a regular way or nested within an object along with its decorator
resources[].resource BaseResource <optional>

class which extends BaseResource
resources[].decorator BaseDecorator <optional>

class which extends BaseDecorator
branding Object <optional>

branding settings

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
logo String <optional>

logo shown in AdminBro in top left corner
companyName String <optional>

company name
softwareBrothers Boolean <optional>

if software brothers logos should be shown in the sidebar footer
Source:
  • admin-bro.js, line 18
Example
const AdminBro = require('admin-bro')

const ArticleDecorator = require('./article-decorator')
const ArticleModel = require('./article')

const connection = await mongoose.connect(process.env.MONGO_URL)

const adminBro = new AdminBro({
  rootPath: '/xyz-admin',
  logoutPath: '/xyz-admin/exit',
  loginPath: '/xyz-admin/sign-in',
  databases: [connection]
  resources: [{ resource: ArticleModel, decorator: ArticleDecorator}]
  branding: {
    companyName: 'XYZ c.o.'
  }
})
